title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Depends of the department hiring managers. Some are quick to call after applying, others are not. If they see that you are a good fit for the organization but not the department you applied for, they will work with you to find one.
Interview Questions: Common interview questions: personal strengths and situational questions.

title: Public Relations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview was done through an online format in which I was given a series of questions and had to record my response to those questions. For each question I had time to think about what I would say and then give my response
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for our company?

title: Patient Safety Assistant (PSA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CoxHealth
Interview Descriptions: It was an online video interview through sparkhire. They asked 5 general questions. They usually call with an offer within a week or two if they offer you the job.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself, what do you know about coxhealth values

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CoxHealth in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Professional, quick response, they called me within a few days of applying and set up an interview quickly. The manager was very approachable and made me feel very comfortable and offered me a pen position in a very timely manner
Interview Questions: Asked general questions about past work experience and how I would handle certain scenarios.

title: Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth
Interview Descriptions: Initially received a phone screening interview with HR recruiter.  Then had an in person interview with the hiring manager. If asked back for a final interview, this final interview format was a peer interview/group panel of RRTs.
Interview Questions: Clinical scenario based.  Knowledge based.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CoxHealth
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy via phone video. They asked basic behavioral questions and questions about past work experience. They asked a lot of questions that related to prioritization of patients. Also asked questions about conflict with coworkers and what you would do
Interview Questions: If you had multiple patients needed something at once what would you do?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CoxHealth
Interview Descriptions: interview process was very well put together. I didnt feel l was judged at all. people seem very nice and am excited to work with them! I didn't feel like the interview was extremely hard which i loved
Interview Questions: name a time when you had a conflict with a customer and how did you resolve it?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Submit portfolio. I had to first complete a one way virtual interview. I think the objective for that is just to comb through applicants and make first impressions. Then there was a first interview with their creative team. After that you are assigned sample projects to complete and then you may or may not get selected for a second interview. All of this has been virtual because of covid.
Interview Questions: They asked me to tell them more about myself (in the professional sense).

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CoxHealth
Interview Descriptions: An introductory phone interview was conducted first, followed by an in person interview. In person questions were framed in a behavioral context while being asked to describe instances in which a situation occurred and how you dealt with it as a therapist.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you disagreed with a COTA's treatment and how you handled it.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CoxHealth
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with members of unit. Questions are predetermined by HR. Those interviewing the interested party cannot ask questions except those on the list. Face to face interviews are preferred but phone interviews may also be conducted.
Interview Questions: Give an example of time you had a conflict with another coworker and how did you handle this?

title: Family Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Lamar, MO) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Phone call from HR and setting up a live interview. 
Met with Office Manager and assistant, was explained the interview process would consist of 3 interview, with this being the first and progress to each level with the final level being with the CEO of the facility.
Interview Questions: What was the most challenging thing upon becoming a Nurse Practitioner to overcome?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with three members of the team including the director of the department. Quick, easy. Laid back experience. The follow up was poor. I had to reach out 2 weeks after for a response.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your hobbies?

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CoxHealth
Interview Descriptions: Received a call to do a video interview, and that an HR person would contact me. Got the call next day, and they sent an email with a link to the video website. Set it up, had a lot of practice and time to answer five questions. Very relaxing.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work at this company

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at CoxHealth in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was a series of interviews, recorded and in-person. The initial interview gives you unlimited attempts to record yourself answering three questions. The next interview was a panel interview with three individuals.  Hiring process took approximately two months.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you demonstrated personal accountability.

title: EMT-Basic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was 100% scripted questions graded in at 1 2 3 multi choice scale It was very impersonal and felt un inviting. This was the format for both the peer and hiring manager portions of the process.
Interview Questions:
What was a challenge I have had to overcome.
?

title: Department Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: HR receives application, Decides if you are an eligible candidate for the position, Sends application to the department, Supervisor or office manager calls to offer an interview, Meet for interview (sometimes 2-3 interviews), HR makes final hiring offer with department approval.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you resolved a conflict between two people.

title: Front Office Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was long and drawn out as it took several weeks to hear back. And the drug testing, Tabasco testing and orientation. Once the hiring process was done work stated almost immediately.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite part about working in healthcare?

title: Financial Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: The process was formal, and scripted, mainly consisting of basic behavioral questions.  With all interviews preparation is key, practicing the basics and understanding how to give examples in your answers is a good idea.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a conflict with a patient?

title: Sterilization Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: There were two people in the interview. It was very relaxed and comfortable. I got to tour the central sterilization department for the hospital. I was told I would be a great fit and he seemed enthusiastic. I unfortunately never got a call back, which I thought was unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Why is the sterilization department an important part of the hospital?

title: Emergency Multi-Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth
Interview Descriptions: Two on one interview with nurse manager and tech/nurse. Very laidback and followed a generic script of questions. Stress of interview depends on which nurse or tech sits in.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you made a mistake. What did you do to correct it?

title: Nurse Assistant Training Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received a confirmation email, and a phone call to set up interview within a couple days. Interviewed and accepted offer within one week. Great communication, the recruiter made herself readily available to answer questions.
Interview Questions: What do you do when you have a huge workload and approaching deadline?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO)
Interview Descriptions: When I was hired for this position I first had an interview with the supervisor. After that went well I had a second interview with a panel of staff. It was a bit overwhelming at the time, but it was nice to get an idea of the work environment with the staff there.
Interview Questions: Describe a time that you had to deal with a conflict in the workplace?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: You went in and set down in the main RN'S office with a one on one. I was asked a couple questions with how i would respond to certain circumstances and he went over the job functions and asked if i could handle it.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest goal in life.

title: Central Process Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CoxHealth
Interview Descriptions: Straight Forward. Manager was a blank slate and professional. No false hopes to mislead the candidate. Staff used 2 supervisors to perform the interview. The process was quick. I applied and was called for an interview less than a week.
Interview Questions: Describe an acheivement

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at CoxHealth
Interview Descriptions: Most was done on the phone.  HR not real friendly and hard to reach.  I could never reach the manager to ask questions.  Management was not engaged in the process
Interview Questions: Resolving conflict.

title: Membership Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with two managers; they took turns asking mostly behavioral questions. They remained very neutral, so it was hard to read if they were feeling positive or negative about me.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had to support a co-worker.

title: E D Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is very easy. They board I interviewed with were very professional yet easy going. I found their questions were not very intimidating at all. They offered the job to on the spot.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you were challenged to do the right thing.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO)
Interview Descriptions: It was brief and straight to the point. Expectations were clearly defined. Skills were reviewed and there was quite a big of testing. I knew before I left the interview that I got the job (pending drug test).
Interview Questions: Education and experience along with scenarios.

title: PSA/Patient Safety Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Got called about two days after applying, went in the next morning after the call, had a few questions about how I handle situations, and got called about a week later saying I got the job.
Interview Questions: How would you handle someone who was upset?

title: Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Had 2 interviews same day. Their hiring process is kinda long. First had a peer interview with 2 current employees in the department who were very nice and easy to talk with. Second interview was with the department manager and supervisor. They were nice also. Was told what days and hours they were needing help with. Asked me if I could work those hours.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict, give an example of a situation in where you dealt with someone that didn't agree with you.

title: Clinic Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview process.  The first interview is 1 on 1 with hiring manager.  There may be a second interview with the providers and/or staff of the clinic.  Series of behavioral questions such as 'tell me about a time when you worked through conflict', 'tell me about a time you had way too much to do and deadlines to meet, how did you handle that'.
Interview Questions: 'tell me about a time when you worked through conflict'

title: Psychiatric Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: They will ask you about previous experience and many times will prefer at least a little past work experience. Does not have to be psych related though again is prefered.
Interview Questions: Describe greatest stengths and weaknesses.

title: Phlebotomy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: They set up the interview about 1 1/2 weeks after application was submitted. Pretty standard questions.  Job offer came a week after interview. If offered a job you do need to pass a urine drug screen and background check.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where a problem was occurring and tell us how you overcame it.

title: Family Nurse Practirioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process was streamlined, and the interview was simply a review of the CV and general questions about experience.  Cox does require a credentialing process that can take 1-3 months to complete, so plan accordingly.  They also require a non compete clause in the contract, for a 50 mile radius.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have?

title: Same Day Surgery Nurse and PACU Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Had a lot of pre-scripted questions for me to answer. Two people were interviewing me for two different positions. It became very confusing because the hours that were posted for the positions were not accurate. The interviewers did not always agree with one another on specific aspects of the job. It made me feel a little awkward when they were not real clear on the hours and expectations.
Interview Questions: How did you deal with the last confrontation you had with your supervisor?

title: Continuous Quality Improvement Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the recruiter via phone first, then in person with staff/peers, and the third interview was with the leader.  Each interview consisted of several questions and the atmosphere was very conversational and relaxed.  They relayed to me the same interview questions were asked of each candidate and each would be rated on their response.  I was encouraged to ask questions and they gave good consideration to all questions asked.
Interview Questions: They asked if I could give examples of projects I had led in the past.

title: Nursing Assistant- Cardiac Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with the nursing manager and charge RN for the cardiac floor.  They started off by giving me a brief job description. They then asked me questions back and fourth about myself and my experience.  At the end of the interview they asked if I had any questions for them.
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Branson, MO) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I filled out the application online. I was then called by the nurse manager to set up an interview. The interview was in a panel format, and then I was later called by the recruiter to be offered the job.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult coworker and how you worked with them.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Branson, MO)
Interview Descriptions: I went through two different interview processes. The first was with Human Relations and the second was with my possible employers (the managers on the floor that I was interested in). For the most part, what they wanted to know was that I was competent, committed, teachable, dependable, and that I truly cared for people.
Interview Questions: What is an example of a time that you messed up and how did you handle that situation?

title: PSA/Patient Safety Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Few days after applying online, I received a call asking me to call them back the next day for a phone interview. Basic stuff, they just laid out the salary and the job description. Some questions like why do you want to work there, experiences, what are your skills that will be of use to them.
After probably 3-5 days, I was called again and asked if I can come by so I can have another interview. I was interviewed by one of the RNs and it was probably 30mins to an hour.
She said she'll let them know probably after a week. 
After 3-5 days again, I received a call from them offering me the job. 
During hiring day, the orientation that they could give me was two weeks away. So hiring and interview process took around 3 to 5 weeks.
Interview Questions:
During the phone interview, I was surprised when I was asked about what skills do I have.
And during the in person interview, was asked if there was a time when I disagreed with someone of authority and what did I do about it.

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: it was very brief and easy. It went very quickly and there was not very many rounds to the process I only had one actual interview with very little testing before hand.
Interview Questions: a conflict arises in the workplace do you settle it amongst the employee or contact the manager.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had several interviews, once they call you in for an interview youll meet with several managers at the same time in one panel interview (I hate this, it makes me nervous) they ask alot of questions and I answered them with flying colors I do belueve the key is to have a few Good questions prepared and dress the part not too dressy if you are in nursing
Interview Questions: Problem solving, team player questions ( they are wanting to know if you'll fit in because they have HUGE clickish and backstabbing issues )

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Met with several managers , call back - met with one manager then sent home , then called back met with Possible coworkers interviewed me. 
Then met with doctor
This took months to be honest it was grueling for such low pay and poor work environment
Interview Questions:
How do you handle stress? 
Education 
Experience
Any questions for us ? This is important be prepaid to ask the panel questions the employees questions and the doctor questions

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and then received a call to come in for an interview. I went through Human Resources first and had a basic screening interview. A week or so after I received a call from the floor manager to schedule an interview. Had an interview in her office with two other assistant managers. They were very kind and I did not feel intimidated. The questions they asked were not too difficult. I received a call the next day with a job offer and I took the job.
Interview Questions: Recall a time when something bad happened and explain how you dealt with it:

title: List Puller Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Talked with the supervisor of the department for about an hour. She asked about my past history of employment. We talked about what the job entailed and duties I would be asked to perform.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, then panel/group interview with presentation. The process moved right along and they maintained good communication with me.  People were friendly, polite, attentive to my presentation.  I'm not sure the job was well-defined - they might need to do some more work on exactly what the position responsibilities are.  People were well dressed -- not stuffy, but not casual -- and seemed rather sophisticated but the overall culture seemed to be a bit old-school. The position was exempt and my impression was that it would require considerably more than 40 hours/week.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself five years from now?

title: Phlebotomy Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: Went on a tour, seemed to be going well, never heard back, only to find out that person was let go!!
Interview Questions: What would cause you to miss work?

title: Patient Safety Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at CoxHealth (Springfield, MO) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Online application and resume submission. Resume is electronically scanned for key words. If it passes the key word check, HR picks it up. A recruiter will call for the initial screening interview to see if you fit any of the job openings  they have. If you do, they call you for second, job-specific interview. They then recommend you to the actual department with the job opening, and you will have two-three interviews with Department heads before they offer you the job. My coworkers and I had a minimum of 3-4 interviews each.
Interview Questions:
Will you work for $6.90 an hour?
This was a tricky question bc with shift differential of $1.00, it put you above minimum wage, but made a strange rule that we could never work day shift because they'd be paying less than minimum wage, which is illegal. My coworkers and I enjoyed patient care, and thought the job was important enough to work for peanuts. (Many employees and managers commented that they believed the job should be volunteer only, and resented the paid staff, however, when they tried volunteers they found they left quickly the first time they were attacked by a patient. The Security Guards are quick, but injuries are part of the job.)
